item.title: About
item.description:
About Me

I am Steve Lengui, a PhD candidate in neuromorphic AI for IoT. My work focuses on optimizing AI models for 32-bit microcontrollers and deploying TinyML on open-source hardware accelerators.

item.title: D√©ployer un mod√®le SNN sur RISC-V avec l'√©mulateur QEMU
item.description:
Introduction

Le d√©ploiement de r√©seaux de neurones spiking (SNN) sur des architectures RISC-V est une √©tape cl√© pour rendre l’IA neuromorphique accessible aux dispositifs IoT √† ressources limit√©es. Dans cet article, nous explorons comment utiliser l’√©mulateur QEMU pour tester et d√©ployer des mod√®les SNN sur une architecture RISC-V.

Pourquoi utiliser QEMU ?

QEMU est un √©mulateur open-source qui permet de simuler des architectures mat√©rielles, y compris RISC-V. Il est particuli√®rement utile pour :

item.title: Deploying an SNN Model on RISC-V with QEMU Emulator
item.description:
Introduction

Deploying spiking neural networks (SNNs) on RISC-V architectures is a key step in making neuromorphic AI accessible to resource-constrained IoT devices. In this article, we explore how to use the QEMU emulator to test and deploy SNN models on a RISC-V architecture.

Why Use QEMU?

QEMU is an open-source emulator that allows simulating hardware architectures, including RISC-V. It is particularly useful for:

  • Testing SNN models without needing physical hardware.
  • Debugging and optimizing model performance before deployment on real hardware.

Steps to Deploy an SNN Model on RISC-V with QEMU

  1. Environment Setup:

item.title: Impl√©mentation d'un mod√®le hybride SNN-QNN sur l'acc√©l√©rateur RISC-V avec l'√©mulateur QEMU
item.description:
Introduction

Les mod√®les hybrides combinant des r√©seaux de neurones spiking (SNN) et des r√©seaux de neurones quantifi√©s (QNN) offrent un √©quilibre entre efficacit√© √©nerg√©tique et pr√©cision. Dans cet article, nous explorons comment impl√©menter un tel mod√®le sur un acc√©l√©rateur RISC-V en utilisant l’√©mulateur QEMU.

Pourquoi un mod√®le hybride SNN-QNN ?

Les mod√®les hybrides SNN-QNN combinent les avantages des deux approches :

  • SNN : Faible consommation d’√©nergie et traitement en temps r√©el.
  • QNN : Pr√©cision accrue gr√¢ce √† la quantification des poids et des activations.

√âtapes pour impl√©menter un mod√®le hybride SNN-QNN sur RISC-V avec QEMU

item.title: Implementation of a Hybrid SNN-QNN Model on RISC-V Accelerator with QEMU Emulator
item.description:
Introduction

Hybrid models combining spiking neural networks (SNNs) and quantized neural networks (QNNs) offer a balance between energy efficiency and accuracy. In this article, we explore how to implement such a model on a RISC-V accelerator using the QEMU emulator.

Why a Hybrid SNN-QNN Model?

Hybrid SNN-QNN models combine the advantages of both approaches:

  • SNN: Low energy consumption and real-time processing.
  • QNN: Increased accuracy through weight and activation quantization.

Steps to Implement a Hybrid SNN-QNN Model on RISC-V with QEMU

  1. Environment Setup:

item.title: Introduction √† l'IA neuromorphique pour les appareils IoT
item.description:
Introduction

L’IA neuromorphique est une approche prometteuse pour les appareils IoT √† ressources limit√©es. Contrairement aux r√©seaux de neurones traditionnels, l’IA neuromorphique s’inspire du fonctionnement du cerveau humain pour cr√©er des syst√®mes capables d’apprendre et de s’adapter de mani√®re plus efficace et √©conome en √©nergie.

Qu’est-ce que l’IA neuromorphique ?

L’IA neuromorphique est une branche de l’intelligence artificielle qui imite la structure et le fonctionnement des neurones biologiques. Elle utilise des r√©seaux de neurones spiking (SNN) pour traiter l’information de mani√®re asynchrone et √©v√©nementielle, ce qui la rend particuli√®rement adapt√©e aux environnements o√π les ressources sont limit√©es.

item.title: Introduction to Neuromorphic AI for IoT Devices
item.description:
Introduction

Neuromorphic AI is a promising approach for resource-constrained IoT devices. Unlike traditional neural networks, neuromorphic AI draws inspiration from the functioning of the human brain to create systems capable of learning and adapting more efficiently and energy-effectively.

What is Neuromorphic AI?

Neuromorphic AI is a branch of artificial intelligence that mimics the structure and functioning of biological neurons. It uses spiking neural networks (SNNs) to process information asynchronously and event-driven, making it particularly suited for environments where resources are limited.

item.title: Publications
item.description:
Recent Publications

2025

  • Efficient Neural Network Implementations on RISC-V Architectures for IoT: A State of the Art and Perspectives for SNN, QNN, and BNN Networks Elsevier to Microprocessors and Microsystems Journal https://acrobat.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:EU:69c3613d-6de3-4b56-8688-2b69b69b4544 Abstract: The proliferation of IoT devices necessitates energy-efficient AI solutions that balance computational demands with power constraints.

  • Implementation of Hybrid Spiking-Quantized Neural Networks on RISC-V for Resource-Constrained IoT Devices Elsevier to Microprocessors and Microsystems Journal https://acrobat.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:EU:23d45602-724f-4750-8140-85dd9a8cdd53 Abstract: This paper presents the implementation of a hybrid Spiking Neural Network (SNN) and Quantized Neural Network (QNN) on RISC-V architecture for resource-constrained IoT devices.

item.title: Optimizing Edge AI for RISC-V
item.description:
Introduction

This post explores techniques for optimizing edge AI models on RISC-V hardware.

Key Techniques

  • Quantization.
  • Pruning.
  • Hardware-aware optimization.

item.title: RISC-V SNN Deployment
item.description:
Overview

This project demonstrates the deployment of spiking neural networks (SNNs) on RISC-V accelerators for ultra-low-power IoT devices.

Key Features

  • SNN Optimization: Reduced power consumption by 60% compared to traditional CNNs.
  • RISC-V Toolchain: Leveraged QEMU for simulation and testing.
  • Real-World Applications: Deployed on IoT sensors for environmental monitoring.

Results

  • Achieved 70% power savings on RISC-V hardware.
  • Published findings in [Microprocessors and Microsystems Journal]

Code Repository

Check out the code on GitHub.

// Exemple de code d'optimisation
void snn_inference() {
 riscv_pulp_io_write(SNN_CFG, 0x1A3F);
 while(!(riscv_pulp_io_read(SNN_STATUS) & 0x1));
}
